class.name: Plane
class.description: Plane represents a normalized plane equation. Basically, "normal" is the normal of the plane (a,b,c normalized), and "d" is the distance from the origin to the plane (in the direction of "normal"). "Over" or "Above" the plane is considered the side of the plane towards where the normal is pointing.

method.name: Plane
method.description: Constructs a default-initialized [Plane] with all components set to [code]0[/code].

method.name: Plane
method.description: Constructs a [Plane] as a copy of the given [Plane].

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from the four parameters. The three components of the resulting plane's [member normal] are [code]a[/code], [code]b[/code] and [code]c[/code], and the plane has a distance of [code]d[/code] from the origin.

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from the normal and the plane's distance to the origin.

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from the given position and a plane normal.

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from the three points, given in clockwise order.

method.name: center
method.description: Returns the center of the plane.

method.name: distance_to
method.description: Returns the shortest distance from the plane to the position [code]point[/code].

method.name: has_point
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [code]point[/code] is inside the plane. Comparison uses a custom minimum [code]epsilon[/code] threshold.

method.name: intersect_3
method.description: Returns the intersection point of the three planes [code]b[/code], [code]c[/code] and this plane. If no intersection is found, [code]null[/code] is returned.

method.name: intersects_ray
method.description: Returns the intersection point of a ray consisting of the position [code]from[/code] and the direction normal [code]dir[/code] with this plane. If no intersection is found, [code]null[/code] is returned.

method.name: intersects_segment
method.description: Returns the intersection point of a segment from position [code]begin[/code] to position [code]end[/code] with this plane. If no intersection is found, [code]null[/code] is returned.

method.name: is_equal_approx
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this plane and [code]plane[/code] are approximately equal, by running [method @GlobalScope.is_equal_approx] on each component.

method.name: is_point_over
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [code]point[/code] is located above the plane.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns a copy of the plane, normalized.

method.name: project
method.description: Returns the orthogonal projection of [code]point[/code] into a point in the plane.

members.member: The distance from the origin to the plane, in the direction of [member normal]. This value is typically non-negative. In the scalar equation of the plane [code]ax + by + cz = d[/code], this is [code]d[/code], while the [code](a, b, c)[/code] coordinates are represented by the [member normal] property.

The normal of the plane, which must be normalized. In the scalar equation of the plane [code]ax + by + cz = d[/code], this is the vector [code](a, b, c)[/code], where [code]d[/code] is the [member d] property.
The X component of the plane's [member normal] vector.
The Y component of the plane's [member normal] vector.
The Z component of the plane's [member normal] vector.

A plane that extends in the X and Z axes (normal vector points +Y).
A plane that extends in the X and Y axes (normal vector points +Z).
